content.description: Essentially an 8-10" offwidth boulder problem but much too scary to try without a toprope,  hop on this incredibly grueling invert roof crack and start grunting. To my knowledge there hasn't been a recorded ascent of this crack but I can't imagine we were the first to try in in 2019.
content.protection: Sling the large flake/chicken head above the crack, a horizontal there will also take cams in the 0.5-0.75 range. If you were to lead this, you'd need a big bro or two, or a couple of crash pads and some chutzpa.
content.location: This is the obvious roof crack about midway through the warm-up wall. Start about 10 feet into the crack, with a block hold on the roof for left hand and a decent crimp on the face for your right.

content.description: Easy climb with a weird start that ends in a sloppy water groove. Great for learning to lead.
content.protection: 2 bolts with rap rings. BD Cams: .2, .4, 1, bd stopper #7
content.location: Furthest left on Boy Scout wall with bolts at the top. Red route in the picture.

content.description: Traverse option to Neckercheif? This allows a trad lead that avoids the boulder start to Neckercheif? Start the same as Eagle Scout Project. Trend right just before placing the first piece.
content.protection: 2 bolts at the top. Mid range bd cams and a #4
content.location: Starts on Eagle Scout Project (blue) and ends on Neckercheif? (Yellow)

content.description: ...I barely know her, chief. Crux is at the beginning, with no good pro options, which gives this the pg13. Bouldery start to this makes it 5.8/5.9. The rest is straight forward. There is a traverse option starting from the left that allows better pro and a lower grade (5.6).
content.protection: 2 bolts for anchor. A few kid sized cams and a bd #4 about 2/3 the way up. Bottom is difficult to protect- use a pad?
content.location: On BSW, 4th line from the left with 2 bolts on top.

content.description: Straight forward. Crux is the mantle-ish bit at the top. Slightly more difficult than Climbing Merit Badge next door. Don’t over think it- it’s not too bad! There is walk- up access to the top.
content.protection: 2 bolts at the top. Mid range nuts and cams.
content.location: On BSW, just right of Climbing Merit Badge. This is the third route with bolts from the left.

content.description: Fun climbing up a groove and some cracks. Crux is right off the ground and a little insecure. Gear is good in the middle and a little trickier up high.
content.location: On the far right side of the Boy Scout area. Another 20 yards right if your looking at the wall from the concrete pad.

content.description: Perfect first outdoor route for someone. Good first lead too. Easy walk up from the back to drop a rope.
content.protection: 2 bolts at the top.  Bd cams: small stuff and a #2. Bd stoppers: #10 and #13
content.location: Just right of Tagalongs. Green route in the picture.

content.description: Easiest climbs at sandrock ranging from 5.6-5.8 and 35-45 ft tall. Easy walk up on the back for folks looking to anchor on some bolts and drop a top rope. Great place for beginners and those learning to lead on gear. These climbs have been well established, but don’t have names or grades that we can find. If they have another name or grade, feel free to leave it in the comments.
